image.altText: writing on a brick painted white

props.synopsis: Construction workers uncovered the message and went on a mission to track down the family of the man who left it there.

title.children: 65-year-old hidden message uncovered in roof of Old Parliament House

image.altText: Unit 36 22 Mowatt Street Queanbeyan East is one of the properties up for resale.

props.synopsis: Dozens of properties owners in the Queanbeyan region will have their homes and businesses sold by force if they don’t pay thousands of dollars in overdue rates payments owed to the local council.

title.children: Dozens of property owners to lose homes and businesses due to unpaid rates

image.altText: Photo illustration of NSW Police officer in silhouette and hands on phone to the left

props.synopsis: A complaint against a NSW Police sergeant was over an incident that allegedly took place during a long drive when he refused to stop the car to allow another officer to use the bathroom.

title.children: Outrage at NSW Police response to complaint against sergeant

image.altText: Two women wearing aprons gardening.

props.synopsis: Vanessa Brettell and Hannah Costello have employed and trained more than 60 migrant and refugee women through their social enterprise cafe Stepping Stone in Canberra. The pair have now been named Australia's Local Heroes for 2025.

title.children: Social enterprise cafe gives migrant and refugee women stepping stone to employment

image.altText: Twenty-four 100 dollar notes and twelve 50 dollar notes on a blue mat on the floor.

props.synopsis: NSW Crime Commission search for the owner of almost $1 million that was seized as part of a drug bust.

title.children: Search for owner of missing $1 million linked to NSW drug bust

image.altText: Man in blue wetsuit and red helmet sits in the back of a boat looking at a river.

props.synopsis: A body believed to be that of a 37-year-old man who went missing in the Murrumbidgee Rive while being towed behind a boat on Australia Day has been found.

title.children: Body found in NSW river during two-day search for missing swimmer

image.altText: A woman works on a model lobster made from felt.

props.synopsis: A group of Darwin artists has recreated tropical mangrove ecosystems with fabric, felt and wire for an exhibition at Questacon in February.

title.children: Artists bring magic of tropical mangroves to life for Canberra exhibition

image.altText: A corrugated rain tank on a stand near a windmill with the bush and grass illuminated red by a fire at night.

props.synopsis: An accommodation and wedding venue and up to two homes in Victoria's west have been destroyed by a bushfire that has burnt through 65,000 hectares of land.

title.children: Lodge and up to two homes destroyed by bushfire in Victoria's west

image.altText: Sam Abdulrahim standing in a gym with boxing gloves on.

props.synopsis: Ex-Mongols bikie Sam Abdulrahim has been shot dead at a car park in Melbourne's north. It comes after multiple attempts on the underworld figure's life.

title.children: Victorian underworld figure Sam 'The Punisher' Abdulrahim shot dead

image.altText: An illustration of a finger tapping on a phone screen with a large padlock being shown on it.

props.synopsis: The ABC analysed 29 million stolen codes to help you avoid using an insecure one.

title.children: We looked at millions of stolen PINs and found the absolute worst one

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, Sundar Pichai and Elon Musk standing on a stage

props.synopsis: While all the focus during US President Donald Trump's inauguration was on tariffs, the sight of four tech titans at the ceremony should have put another economic policy on the radar: Tax.

title.children: Trump's powerful new allies don't much like Australia

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton stand next to each other.

props.synopsis: Australians could head to the polls in a federal election within months. So when will it be and what are the key seats in the battle to lead the country?

title.children: The states that will decide the next federal election

image.altText: A man in suit gestures at a podium with flags in the background.

props.synopsis: The treasurer is quick to downplay speculation the government could be in striking distance of a third budget surplus.

title.children: Treasurer pours cold water on budget surplus talk — as it happened

image.altText: A gold $1 Australian coin in the centre, surrounded by other coins

props.synopsis: The weaker Australian dollar is welcome news for businesses that export to countries like the US, but the lower currency can be a drain on travellers' budgets and hit import businesses.

title.children: The Australian dollar faces a Trump tariff stress test

image.altText: An man escaping a building with smoke billowing out of it.

props.synopsis: A fire ripped through a Gold Coast apartment after a resident tried to cool an overheating e-scooter battery in a freezer, with one man climbing off a balcony to safety.

title.children: Unit explodes into flames after hot e-scooter battery put in freezer

image.altText: A phone with DeepSeek on it. Behind it is a screen with ChatGPT

props.synopsis: DeepSeek's AI assistant — a direct competitor to ChatGPT — has become the number one downloaded free app on Apple's App Store, with some worrying the Chinese startup has disrupted the US market.

title.children: What is DeepSeek? Why the AI startup is up-ending the US stock market

image.altText: Telstra logo, optus logo and ACMA logo with a man holding a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: The telecommunications regulator cut a deal with Optus behind closed doors that reduced the potential financial penalty it was facing for committing serious public safety breaches, documents released to the ABC have revealed.

title.children: Internal emails reveal 'inappropriate' dealings between regulator and Optus, Telstra

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: a man talking

props.synopsis: Health Minister Tim Nicholls unveiled the pause on Tuesday as he also announced a review into the evidence for stage one and two hormone therapies for children with gender dysphoria.

title.children: Queensland government halts hormone treatment for new patients under 18

image.altText: woman holding child and talking on phone while using laptop

props.synopsis: Chronic connectivity and inequity in the home are partly to blame for why two-thirds of women say they feel unable to switch off from work.

title.children: Why women find it hard to switch off from work

image.altText: Four radio telescopes behind a backdrop of stars.

props.synopsis: It was the first trial of new technology developed in Australia by astronomers and engineers at the national science agency, CSIRO.

title.children: New CSIRO technology detects more than 20 mysterious signals in space

image.altText: Molly Picklum walking up the beach with a surfboard under her arm

props.synopsis: The start of the World Surf League season has been delayed for at least two days due to poor conditions at Hawaii's Banzai Pipeline.

title.children: Surfing's Championship Tour opener postponed at famous Pipeline

image.altText: Firefighters carry out rescue operations on an aircraft

props.synopsis: The first report on last month's Jeju Air crash in South Korea confirms traces of bird strikes in the plane's engines.

title.children: South Korean plane crash report says bird remains were found in engines

image.altText: Shark carcass lies on the sand along the beach

props.synopsis: Research confirms a great white shark that washed up on a beach in south-west Victoria was the victim of killer whale predation.

title.children: Bite mark swabs show orcas killed 4.7m great white shark

image.altText: US Special Counsel Jack Smith

props.synopsis: The move comes after special counsel Jack Smith resigned from the department this month after submitting a two-volume report on the twin criminal investigations into Donald Trump.

title.children: Prosecutors who worked on Trump criminal investigation fired

image.altText: Aerial shot of rows of white battery containers in the foreground and coal plant/cooling tower in background

props.synopsis: In Western Australia, the world's largest island grid is taking a huge bet, and carrying out a major experiment, on the role of batteries in the energy transition.

title.children: In the world's largest isolated grid, a big bet is being placed on giant batteries

image.altText: A police car in front of a utility in a paddock.

props.synopsis: Police say they were chasing a stolen utility when it crashed into a motorcycle and killed the rider near Gunnedah this morning.

title.children: Three teens arrested after fatal crash during police chase in NSW

image.altText: Fatima Payman

props.synopsis: Ex-Labor senator Fatima Payman says Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has been "petty" in delaying approval of additional staff for her office, more than six months after she quit the party.

title.children: Fatima Payman says Anthony Albanese withholding staff in 'petty games'

image.altText: Air conditioner units on the exterior of a hospital.

props.synopsis: Over the past 30 years, a technology we barely notice has quietly shaped where and how Australians live. But our love of 'manufactured air' also comes at a cost.

title.children: Air conditioning quietly changed Australian life in just a few decades

image.altText: gazans at crossing

props.synopsis: Hamas has told the Israeli government that 8 hostages due for release are dead, as Palestinians head north in the first phase of the ceasefire with Gaza.

title.children: Hamas says eight Israeli hostages are dead as Palestinians head home

image.altText: Crowds at a harbour beach in Sydney on a summer day

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology issued a heatwave warning on Monday and said it would continue until Thursday.

title.children: Sydney to swelter in temperatures exceeding 40 degrees

image.altText: palm trees cloudy

props.synopsis: Queensland records its latest start to a monsoon season in 70 years, as authorities monitor several offshore weather systems that could develop into tropical cyclones.

title.children: Cyclone risk as north Queensland braces for heavy rain, likely floods

image.altText: an ID photo superimposed on a photo of a pile of loose tobacco

props.synopsis: Queensland's crime watchdog has wielded controversial confiscation laws against alleged sellers of illicit tobacco for the first time.

title.children: Bank accounts, properties linked to alleged illicit tobacco seller frozen

image.altText: A still from The Brutalist, featuring Brody smoking and looking down at sparks flying from the ground through a night blue sky.

props.synopsis: Nominated for 10 Academy Awards, including Best Picture, The Brutalist is an audacious epic about a Holocaust survivor and architect trying to rebuild his life in the US.

title.children: Up for 10 Oscars, The Brutalist is an awe-inspiring epic
